basics.name: Daniel Plas Rivera
basics.label: Lead Senior Software Engineer
basics.summary: 15+ years of experience in software engineering, specializing in GenAI/LLM integration, cloud infrastructure, and data engineering. Passionate about building intelligent systems that leverage AI to transform business processes. Expert in modern Python stacks, AWS architecture, and full-stack development.

work.summary: Architecting Big Data solutions and GenAI/LLM product development for 25+ teams. Lead end-to-end AI-powered solutions for financial services workflows, cost optimization analysis, and intelligent document processing. Drive innovation in LLM integration, multi-model AI comparison, and enterprise-scale data pipelines.
highlights: Built intelligent document processing platform with GenAI-powered cost optimization analysis, integrating 8 LLMs in parallel (GPT-4, Claude Opus/Sonnet, Gemini, Perplexity) for multi-model comparison with real-time quality scoring across 4 dimensions (Relevance, Completeness, Actionability, Technical Accuracy)

Implemented multi-model comparison feature enabling product teams to evaluate AI model performance side-by-side with automated hallucination detection, response quality assessment, and cost-per-token analysis to inform production model selection

Architected multi-stage financial services workflow with automated opportunity identification, lever mapping using GenAI, currency conversion across 14 currencies (BPS/EUR/USD/GBP/AUD/etc), and human-in-the-loop validation system for AI-generated insights
Engineered PostgreSQL/pgvector migration from ChromaDB for embeddings storage, achieving sub-100ms similarity search performance on 100K+ vectors with proper indexing and connection pooling
Designed AWS S3 document repository infrastructure using Terraform with KMS encryption, event notifications for automated ingestion pipelines, and audit trail logging for compliance

Built multi-currency auto-conversion system supporting real-time transformation across all cost analysis tables using reactive programming patterns and efficient data transformations (EUR Mn = (BPS × AuM Bn) / 10)
Developed comprehensive unit test suite with 72+ tests covering workflow logic, data processing, currency conversion, LLM integration, and human validation workflows

Architected enterprise data lake infrastructure using AWS CloudFormation, S3, and Snowflake, enabling unified analytics across multiple business units with proper data classification and cybersecurity compliance
Led data engineering proof of concept prototypes, pipeline designs and final implementation for business-critical data sources
Directed technical refinement of vendors' data technologies, evaluating and integrating third-party solutions into enterprise data stack

Stack: Python, Streamlit, FastAPI, PostgreSQL, pgvector, Anthropic Claude API, OpenAI GPT API, Google Gemini API, Perplexity API, Terraform, AWS (S3, KMS, Lambda, Kinesis, Glue, CloudFormation), Alembic, SQLAlchemy, Asyncio, Pandas, Plotly, Snowflake, Azure Blob Storage, Docker, Kubernetes, GoCD, GitHub Actions, JIRA

work.summary: Lead data engineering for multiple teams tasked with data analytics and insights needs. Responsible for end-to-end solutions managing 10+ data sources including Slack, Zoom, Microsoft Teams, SharePoint, Outlook, Box, and VPN monitoring. Built enterprise-scale data pipelines processing 100s of millions of API calls daily with automated Snowflake ingestion.
highlights: Led Zoom Legacy Webhook Migration, architecting webhook validation pipelines with secure handshake implementation using Lambda Authorizers, recovering broken data streams and reducing API rate limit issues for enterprise-scale data ingestion

Architected Slack production data platform with 10+ AWS Glue pipelines using Pydantic for static mapping and security compliance, implementing API optimization that reduced calls from 16.5M to sub-million daily while maintaining data completeness

Deployed VPN monitoring data streaming solution on production with full AWS stack: API Gateway with WAF IP whitelisting, Lambda Authorizers, KMS-encrypted S3 buckets, Kinesis Stream/Firehose, enabling cross-channel analytics for support operations

Engineered Slack data automation in Snowflake with snowpipes, streams, tasks, and merge/upsert logic for 200-day backfills across analytics tables, implementing AWS Step Functions orchestration for dependency-based pipeline execution

Achieved 80% unit test coverage across 10+ Glue pipelines from 0%, meeting enterprise quality gate standards with comprehensive test suites covering Microsoft SharePoint, Exchange, Teams device usage, and collaboration analytics

Implemented security scanning for data engineering repository, enabling real-time SAST, secret scanning, SCA, and IAC security with pre-commit hooks, preventing credential leaks and ensuring compliance across 100+ data pipelines

Resolved 10+ critical security vulnerabilities including EC2 IMDSv2 migration, S3 CMK enforcement (replacing AWS-managed keys), WAF rule additions, SSH port 22 restrictions, and CloudFormation template security hardening for collaboration platform pipelines

Built event tracking pipeline with Terraform IaC, deploying to production with Snowflake cross-account storage integrations (DEV/TEST/PROD), upgrading AWS Glue 4.0 → 5.0 for modernized Spark environments

Optimized Microsoft Teams and Outlook pipelines by fixing SparkContext shutdown errors, GATEWAY TIMEOUT issues, and EC2 crash problems during large backfills, implementing semaphore count reduction and Graph API mapping for complete analytics datasets

Created data enrichment system for office attendance monitoring with Snowflake tasks running every 24 hours, maintaining historic snapshots with automated error monitoring and alerting for PII mapping
Reduced AWS expenditure rate by 99.6% and over $47k per year by rearchitecting AWS Serverless solutions to AWS Kinesis for high-throughput data streaming
Led Zoom 12-month backfill project for Webinar Report data, recovering historical data and ensuring completeness
Direct technical refinement of vendors' data technologies at The Firm
Manage risk in data warehouse with Cybersecurity to ensure data meets The Firm's data classification policy
Architect roadmaps, diagrams, and plans for multiple stages of development
Conceptualize & lead workshops on how to send various data sources into Snowflake
Guide unified data lake initiative to better data insights for The Firm
Build and maintain multiple asynchronous Python applications and Snaplogic pipelines to maximize data ingestion of REST APIs to perform ETL on 100s of gigabytes of data daily
Stand up cloud infrastructure that provides the foundation our Firm's data analytics
Create Kafka & Kinesis big data streams for product data
Work with diverse teams on preparing their data for the datalake
Craft intelligent systems to alert engineer teams of data inconsistencies
Construct pipelines to grab Splunk logs for data analytics dashboard needs
Make snowpipes, snowstages, and stored procedures for externally staged data in Azure Blob and AWS S3

Stack: Python, Pydantic, AWS Glue (4.0/5.0), Spark, Snowflake (Snowpipes, Streams, Tasks, Storage Integrations), AWS (Lambda, Kinesis, Firehose, S3, KMS, Step Functions, API Gateway, WAF, EC2, CloudFormation), Terraform, Slack Discovery API, Zoom Webhook API, Microsoft Graph API, Box Events API, Golden Frog, Wiz, Azure Blob Storage, Snaplogic, Docker, GoCD, Kubernetes, SonarQube, Pre-commit hooks

work.summary: Created PwC Data Landscape, an analyzer to determine the risk level of data provided by a client.
highlights: Created the backend for the React SPA to consume
Learned and implemented proprietary PwC React components
Developed stakeholder's vision to detect and assess security risks of uploaded data
Architect roadmaps, diagrams, and plans for various stages of development
Stack: Docker, Django3 , Python3, Graphene, Graphql, DRF, React

work.summary: Architected/rebuilt Credit Risk Rating Platform enabling internal systems to perform risk rating of customers and facilities aiding bank decision making in credit approval process, as well as ongoing portfolio management.
highlights: Created dockerized microservices with clear documentation
Provided code reviews and broke epics into stories for the team
Highly detailed documentation per micro service and python package
Built microservice for utlizing data models for finding Probability of default of a client
Worked with team to create a new platform featuring aspects of its predecessor
Stack: Python, flask, sqlalchemy, oracle, postgres, jenkins, docker, docker-compose, artifactory

work.position: Sr. Python Full Stack Engineer - Contractor
work.summary: Full Stack Python Engineer in Finance & Insurance, focused on Docker Container infrastructure, Pipelines in CI/CD and SOA Appliances. Analyzed and improved pre-existing architecture increasing performance of services and platform.
highlights: Made Jenkins groovy scripts to build, upload, and deployment of new docker images to Artifactory on Git PR merges
Utilized New Relic and Splunk for identifying under performing flows, issues and bottlenecks
Optimized code to improve performance and scalability
Documented new and undocumented services
Stack: Python, django, flask, celery, react, redis, oracle, postgres, mongodb, jenkins, docker, docker-compose, IBM datapower, artifactory, splunk, new relic

work.summary: Implemented VPN technologies into PwC internal tax audit platform on Azure. Used Docker/Docker-Compose to launch VPN containers when initiated by PaaS.
highlights: Debugged React and Django integrations
Worked on VPN features for our internal tax audit platform, developed frontend, and backend solutions utilizing Django
Refactored Python applications for SnapLogic data pipelines
Built vSEC lab environments to mimic possible virtualized security solution configurations
Stack: Python3, celery, celery beat, redis, sqlite, react, django, docker, docker-compose, VSTS, Azure, ip-sec, vpn, openconnect, Snaplogic, AWS, Checkpoint Vsec, pulse secure

work.summary: Collaborated cross functionally to develop target state cloud architecture and supporting organization model along with the platform roadmap required to achieve that target state.
highlights: Built REST APIs to match specs provided by other teams to deliver needed functionality
Executed POCs and feasibility studies to validate next-gen product concepts and technologies leveraging results to guide business and technology decisions
Enforced adherence to architectural standards/principles, global product-specific guidelines, usability design standards
Stack: Python3, Microsoft Azure, Terraform, Packer, Git, Flask, Flask-RestPlus, MongoDB, TDD, Agile, Kanban, Jenkins

work.summary: Transitioned University to a Python stack while maintaining compatibility with legacy technologies.
highlights: Interviewed and selected candidates to assist on building University applications
Built Full Stack Python Applications for the University
Wrote Python scripts to parse JSON documents and load the data in database
Development locally with Vagrant and Docker for virtualized instances of servers and databases on the fly
Built REST APIs to serve out data from databases to legacy systems
Programmatically established levels of authorized access to restrict-allow systems REST API access
Created and planned out the server flow infrastructure for python web app stack for Columbia University
Followed Agile SDLC, made sure code was always up to PEP8 standards, and servers (with code) passed unit & load tests

Stack: Python3, python2, GIT, Flask/Blueprint, JIRA, Apache 2.2, Mod_WSGI, Oracle(11g,12c), Axure RP, Vagrant, Docker, Jenkins, Virtualbox, Postman, LTI, Oauth1, Oauth2, REST, Sakai, Canvas, Unix Bash/Shell Script, CRON, JavaScript, Nodejs, JSON

work.summary: Based on your location, you will access real time local information.
highlights: Implemented Google Maps for our platform and styled it for plotting our data
Created menu using React.JS for restful api CRUD events for events management and notifications
Recreated app in React Native with focus on iOS

Guided students through the challenges of becoming a developer
Led weekly one-on-one online student questions/answers sessions to provide feedback on student code and projects

Developed page to let users sort the received api feed and browse by location, job function, category
Stack: Git, Heroku, Ruby, Middleman Framework, REST, JavaScript, Jslint, JSON, Twitter Bootstrap, SCSS, Media Queries.

highlights: Interviewed and hired candidates to aid in e-commerce system development and refinements of our products
On boarded and trained the team for Full stack Web Development and the SEO team
Worked with Google Online Strategist to revamp ad campaigns, increase sales, and raise our site ranking
Worked with Google Tag Implementation Team to complete the installation of Dynamic Re-marketing Code and E-Commerce Tracking in Magento for adwords

awards.title: Hack NYU Hackathon
awards.summary: MVP Winner. SudoLove connects participants, sponsors and mentors for global hackathons via an app.

awards.title: AngelHack 2016 Manhattan
awards.summary: Winning Grand Prize(Hackcelerator) and Best Use Of Amazon Web Services. New York Minute is your pocket companion app to eliminate the frustration of getting around in New York City. It calculates the fastest, cheapest way to get to the desired destination by comparing the Uber car service and public transportation. Target users are New Yorkers who understand the fast pace of New York City life. Sponsors Technologies used Amazon AWS: Elastic Beanstalk, EBS, EC2, Route 53, S3 Amazon Alexa Esri ArcGIS.

references.name: Latonia Robinson, Dir. of Operations, The K.I.S. Foundation
references.reference: Daniel is an absolute joy to work with and continues to impress us with his technical skill sets. Whenever we have a problem with our website, he always has the answer or recommendations for improvement. Daniel follows direction well, he's always aware of the latest programs or trends, he works well with deadlines, he's able to communicate effectively, he's super reliable, and his experience is absolutely priceless. We're so thankful to have him working with us as part of our team!

references.name: Antonio Riccardi, Web Engineer at Basics Plus
references.reference: Daniel is one of the best developers we know. His speed and ability to conquer any challenge thrown at him helped us recover our online presence. He led our team here through rigorous challenges with unique solutions each time always getting the job done before the deadlines. Working with him was a blast and we would recommend him when it comes to handling tough projects!
